results.title: The Many adventures of Winnie the Pooh
results.creator_credit: Wolfgang Reitherman, Walt Disney Pictures and John Lounsbery
results.brief_description: This compendium of animated shorts features three stories: “Winnie the Pooh and the honey tree”. Anytime is the right time for honey, according to Pooh. This film follows him through a series of misadventures brought about by his fondness for sweet treats, showing how Pooh gets himself into - and out of - several sticky situations. In “Winnie the Pooh and the blustery day”, Pooh visits his Thoughtful Spot and then, because of the wind, joins in some antics with Piglet. In “Winnie the Pooh and Tigger too” Rabbit, Pooh, and Piglet plan to unbounce Tigger, but discover they like a bouncy Tigger best. Features the voices of Sterling Holloway, Paul Winchell, Sebastian Cabot and others.

results.title: The Manufacture of gas
results.brief_description: A description of gas manufacture showing all stages from the raw material, coal, to the storage of finished product in gas-holders. Shows also the extraction of by-products such as coke, tar, benzol, dyes and disinfectants. The film stresses the economy of gas manufacture compared with the burning of coal in fireplaces or the generation of electricity using coal as raw material.

results.title: The Manton plan
results.creator_credit: Don Anderson, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Sherry James
results.brief_description: Shows how a local municipality goes about establishing a “Disaster Plan”, and putting the plan into operation when a bus crashes on the outskirts of the town and all services are brought into action.

results.title: The Manhattan odyssey
results.creator_credit: Francois Seguillon, ONF | NFB and Bernard Gosselin
results.brief_description: The epic voyage of the giant American oil tanker, the U.S.S. Manhattan, and the Canadian icebreaker, the John A. Macdonald, through the Northwest passage of the Canadian Arctic to test its navigability as a year-round commercial sea lane. Filmed from the ice, from a helicopter, and from aboard the two ships, this film captures the natural drama of the journey as the ships batter and buck their way through the heavy sea ice.

results.title: The management of work centres for the handicapped
results.creator_credit: Francis Haveron, United Motion Pictures, Heron Film Productions and Michael Holmes
results.brief_description: Describes the process of management through the management committee, the work centre manager and his staff. It shows work produced by physically handicapped workers which includes packing, assembling wire products, various machine operations and handicrafts.

results.title: The Man, the snake and the fox
results.brief_description: This film is a dramatization of a traditional Ojibwa legend; it is told to a group of children from the Wandereing Spirit Survival School. As the story unfolds, the characters played by puppets assume increasingly human characteristics. The moral of the fable: do not make promises that cannot be kept.

results.title: The Man you loved to hate
results.brief_description: A career biography of one of Hollywoods most flamboyant showmen, Erich Von Stroheim. Film clips, interviews, and excerpts from thirty Von Stroheim films are used to reconstruct a portrait of the man behind the legend.

results.title: The Man you know
results.creator_credit: Beth McRae, McRae Saunders Productions, Australian Film Commission and Steve Jacobs
results.brief_description: A strange and unusual film about one man’s struggle for identity, his alienation with the world of today and his attempts to remain shut off from all that is offensive and intrusive, and yet which eventually leads him on a frenetic search amongst his books, magazines and photographs for Bob Proudfoot, “The man you know”. Using photographic images, newspaper articles, background voices and narration, this satirical experimental film attacks just about all areas that were once considered taboo, or not open for discussion, in Australia - politics, religion, sex, family life. Cast includes Lance Curtis as the young man and Steve Jacobs as the voice of Bob Proudfoot.

results.title: The Man with the movie camera = Chelovek s kinoapparatom
results.brief_description: Writer/Director/Editor, Dziga-Vertov, was made Head of the Cinema Department of the All Russian Central Executive at the age of 22. His film shows all the tricks of which the camera is capable. Vertov shows Russia as it really is; indeed, the final impact of the film arises from a feeling of participation in life itself as we share the unique vision of the camera-eye.
